question: First of all, I'd like to ask you a few questions about your personal life. What is the first thing you do when you get up in the morning?
reply: I'll take a shower and then make a cup of coffee.

question: Do you have breakfast?
reply: Yes. It's simple, but I make hot sandwiches in the pie iron.

question: I see. Are you a good cook?
reply: Yes. I've always made a lot of meals by myself. If I'm at home, I'll just cook what I want to eat in the evening, like Chinese or Western food.

question: Do you pay attention to your diet?
reply: This is the kind of work I do, and of course I try to count calories and eat healthy foods.

question: What is your favorite food?
reply: I know that's not what you said earlier, but it's pancakes... I've conquered all the restaurants that are known for good pancakes in Tokyo.

question: You seem to have a real passion for pancakes. How do you spend your time off work?
reply: In the morning, I'll go to the gym or run for about 10 kilometers. After that, I'll go home and watch a movie or read a book, which is surprisingly low-key.

question: You run that much even on your days off? Where do you run on your days off?
reply: There's a running course in a large park nearby. There are a lot of students in the track and field club that run there, so it's very inspiring.

question: Do you have gym or running essentials?
reply: I sweat a lot, so as long as I have two towels and my phone, I'm good to go.

question: Do you have a favorite place in Tokyo?
reply: I think I might prefer the nature and the old townscape to the city.

question: I'm surprised to hear that. Don't you feel comfortable in the city, for example in areas where celebrities often congregate?
reply: It's not that I'm avoiding it, but... I often go there for meetings and events, and not so much in my free time.

question: What are you enjoying most right now?
reply: Forgive me for being boring, but before I came here today, I bought some new running shoes from online. I'm secretly looking forward to running in them.

question: Do you have a favorite genre of music?
reply: There is a female photographer and editor who is very knowledgeable about this, so recently I've been listening to Western music that she taught me about. I don't have a favorite.

question: If you had to choose, which do you like better, singing or dancing?
reply: It would be singing.

question: By the way, what was your first impression when you heard "Shock Out, Dance!!" for the first time?
reply: If I could make this song my own, I felt like I'd be one step closer to the peak of idols.

question: How would you describe "Shock out, Dance!!" in one word?
reply: LizNoir's style. This is the music that you can feel it the most.

question: What is your favorite lyric in "Shock out, Dance!!"?
reply: "Don't stop dancing, we all have pain. They want to see people they'll never see again". It's very much linked to how I felt when I was going through a lot...

question: How did you feel about that?
reply: Fufu, that's a secret indeed. You can take a guess from the lyrics.

question: So how would you describe your relationship with the members of LizNoir in one word?
reply: It's probably a bit deeper than colleagues... it's more like a partner that has your back.

question: When was the moment you felt a bond with the members in your activities so far?
reply: When I'm having a hard time, both physically and mentally, it's strange to have one of the members next to me. When that happens, you can't help but feel a bond with them.

question: I can see how strong the bond is. Is there someone you consider your best friend in your heart?
reply: I don't think the term "best friend" is quite appropriate, but we've known each other for a long time, especially Aoi (Igawa). I don't know how she feels about it, though.

question: Do you have any dreams that you would like to achieve as a LizNoir member?
reply: The goal is to become the top of the idol world with these members. That's all I want.

question: If that dream were to come true, who would you report to first?
reply: My mother, who has always supported me.

question: Are there any problems that you are having recently?
reply: To put it nicely, we have a group of unique members, so it's hard to train them so that they don't have any rough edges.

question: Next, I'd like to ask you a few questions about idols. Kanzaki, please tell us why you wanted to become an idol.
reply: Initially, it wasn't for a reason that I can say here... but in this industry, it's all about winning, no matter what the reason is.

question: I see. When was the last time you worked the hardest in your life?
reply: Hmm... I've been working as hard as ever since before my debut. I work hard to make sure more people can see our performances.

question: What is the most important thing for you as an idol?
reply: I always aim for the best performance to satisfy my fans. For that reason, I pay a lot of attention to my daily lessons and conditions. Aoi and Kokoro (Akasaki) are not good at it sometimes, so I scold them.

question: I'd like to see the members getting scolded by Kanzaki-san. What do you think your fans are like to you?
reply: There's no doubt that they're the most important people in our lives. Also, our fans are very remarkable. That's why I have to stand up straight, and I can't show them how sloppy I am.

question: What was the happiest gift you received from those fans?
reply: It's hard to decide what's the best. But sometimes when I receive a bouquet of flowers, I feel very energized. Maybe it's not really my style, but...

question: No, no, it's a very good look for you. Then, with the phrase "I'm not going to lose to anyone at this!" in mind, what are your strengths as an idol?
reply: I never want to lose to other idols in terms of singing, dancing and overall performance at the live shows.

question: How did you feel when you first got on stage as LizNoir?
reply: I think I may have been trying to be strong, thinking that this was finally going to happen. When I watch the video now, I'm reflecting on a lot of things. If you think about it that way, LizNoir is evolving more and more.

question: What does a (live performance) mean to you?
reply: It's a place where you can connect with your fans. It's like a conversation through a live concert.

question: I'm glad to hear stories that are typical of you as a frontline performer. If you hadn't become an idol, what do you think you'd be doing?
reply: I can't imagine, because I ran at full speed to become an idol. But I might have still been with my mother in my hometown.

question: What is your favorite memory from your childhood?
reply: My parents' house is a coffee shop, and my mother would be tending the counter. When I came home from school and opened the door, the bell would ring. I remember the sound of the bell.

question: What kind of child were you at that time, do you think?
reply: I think I was quite a precocious child. I was tall and fashion-conscious, and my mother got mad for playing with her cosmetics.

question: That's cute. Can you tell us about your dreams at the time?
reply: I was already interested in idols. But until I got serious about it, it may have felt somewhat distant.

question: So let's talk about some of your school days. How did you spend your time at school?
reply: I've enjoyed running since those days, and I was on the track club. We competed against each other every morning and night, running all day long, so I think my competitive nature may have been formed at that time.

question: So you liked to run even then? How about your studies?
reply: I'm good at studying, I think. I was good at it, and I didn't slack off in my studies.

question: Kanzaki-san, you don't seem to be one to slack on anything. What's the happiest moment you've ever had?
reply: There was a time when I took a break from performing, but when I saw the members who had been waiting for me and believed in me again.

question: Then, what was the most frustrating moment for you so far?
reply: That was the first time I saw a certain idol. To be honest, I didn't want to admit that they existed.

question: I'm very curious about it. Is that person a rival of yours?
reply: A rival... yes, I guess that's right. It's safe to assume so.

question: What is your ideal image of an idol?
reply: Idols that will remain in the hearts of everyone. I think there are only a few idols like that out there.

question: What would you like to say to yourself 10 years from now?
reply: Is it true that you've already retired? Either way, I'm sure you're making your dream come true with all of LizNoir.

question: What does an idol mean to you?
reply: I think we need to create a space that fans can only experience at that time and place, and make them happy.

question: Lastly, could you give a word to your fans?
reply: Thank you for your support. LizNoir tends to be seen as a rather hard-core band, but we hope that people who haven't seen us perform live will feel free to come and enjoy it.
